teaser: First up, NYT tech columnist Molly Wood talks about a new feature on YouTube that'll tell content creators what would happen to their video if it contains copyrighted music. Then, Robin Feldman, Director of the Institute for Innovation Law at the University of California Hastings, discusses the implications behind Swedish police's raid of Pirate Bay's servers. We'll also talk to the BBC's Dave Lee about old laptop batteries powering slums in India.
title: Marketplace Tech for Wednesday, December 10, 2014
description: First up, NYT tech columnist Molly Wood talks about a new feature on YouTube that'll tell content creators what would happen to their video if it contains copyrighted music. Then, Robin Feldman, Director of the Institute for Innovation Law at the University of California Hastings, discusses the implications behind Swedish police's raid of Pirate Bay's servers. We'll also talk to the BBC's Dave Lee about old laptop batteries powering slums in India.
